duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan, direct, and coordinate construction operations, purchases, financial reporting, and project controls activities for an assigned portfolio of concurrent electrical projects.
Review project contracts, negotiate revisions, changes, and additions to contractual agreements with owners, architects, consultants, clients, suppliers, and subcontractors.
Prepare project controls, budget setup, schedules of values/billing mechanisms, and maintain each in collaboration with operational subordinates.
Execute major project purchases in collaboration with the operations team and regional leadership.
Manage project profitability for each project in his/her portfolio of work. This includes predictive analysis and revenue, cost, and profit forecasting.
Evaluate construction methods and determine cost-effectiveness of plans and actual work.
Develop and implement quality control programs on projects.
Regularly visit projects to assess performance, progress, and quality and to ensure connectivity with the field and clients.
Produce a schedule of values or similar method for all projects to ensure positive cash flow on projects.
Execute and manage all billing for all assigned projects.
Prepare budgets for construction activities, oversee progress, and cost reports.
Ensure proper administration of payroll, material/subcontractor payments, and owner progress and final payments in conjunction with corporate support functions.
Develop and maintain relationships with peers at clients, architectural and engineering firms, and trade partners to ensure successful outcomes of projects.

education_certification.credential: BS in Construction Management, Electrical Engineering or equivalent work experience
